availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas B. Cochran (Shelby County, KY, attorney and officer (2nd KY Cav. U.S.A.))

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Spencer County, Kentucky, native. Attended Transylvania University in Lexington, Kentucky. Married to Margaret E. Thorpe on June 22, 1852. Attorney in Shelby County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1860. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel from September 27, 1861, to November 24th, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 1, p.238
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District No. 1, p. 274A.
Thomas B. Cochran and Margaret E. Thorpe, Kentucky, County Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Shelby County, June 22, 1852, (Accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 46.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1867), 915.
“Thomas B. Cochran: Death of the Chancellor of Louisville Yesterday--Action of the Courts and Bar,” Courier-Journal (Louisville, Kentucky) 22 January 1873, p. 4.
